Every time you go on Facebook and answer those cute personality tests, about what country you should live in, or how many books you have read, you are handing over tons of information about yourself.
— that Cambridge Analytica "harvested" information about them on Facebook to craft target audiences for political ads.
Why would anyone think these are "private," when this is being done on the largest platform in human history?
Every time you "like" a political ad or hang out with like-minded fans of various TV shows, the same.
The American people are shocked — shocked, do you hear?
To the editor: What were people thinking?
Every time you follow click bait, etc.
